item.title: Make pesto zoodles (recipe) | TahoeDailyTribune.com
item.description:
Make pesto zoodles (recipe) | TahoeDailyTribune.com

Is your spiralizer sitting under your cabinet in its original box? Sometimes we get kitchen gadgets as a gift and never use them. Well, this is one of those gifts you just have to use. It's so simple and helps make eating raw veggies even simpler!

item.title: Genova Deli: 31 years of authentic Italian
item.description:
Genova Deli: 31 years of authentic Italian

The aroma is the first thing that hits you after stepping into Napa's Genova Deli - a combination of spices, salamis, cheeses, fresh breads and other scents. "It's Italian potpourri," co-owner Patti DeVincenzi said with a smile. Customers are always commenting about it.

item.title: Wine briefs: Sequoia Grove's Busquaert earns top award
item.description:
Wine briefs: Sequoia Grove's Busquaert earns top award

Sequoia Grove's Busquaert earns top award Dean Busquaert, senior wine educator at Sequoia Grove Winery, was awarded the Robert Mondavi Excellence Award by the Concierge Alliance of Napa Valley and Sonoma (CANVAS).

item.title: NVV announces Restaurant Wine List Award winners
item.description:
NVV announces Restaurant Wine List Award winners

The Napa Valley Vintners recently announced the recipients of its 2016 Napa Valley Wine List Awards at a community celebration at Goosecross Cellars in Yountville. The event included restaurant award recipients, local vintners and community officials. More than 85 restaurants, from the pioneering All Seasons restaurant in Calistoga to newcomer Basalt in Napa, were recognized for their emphasis on serving local wines.

item.title: San Francisco, CA, United States for Wine, Wine, Wine, and Other Napa Valley Facts
item.description:
San Francisco, CA, United States for Wine, Wine, Wine, and Other Napa Valley Facts

Everything from the picturesque drive, to the quintessential vineyards is downright beautiful, and there will be ample opportunities for insta-worthy photos. napa valley facts - grapesThere are many knowns when it comes to Napa: known - there is wine, known - there are delicious restaurants, known - it's best to wear dark colors if you enjoy red wine, so on and so forth.

item.title: Napa's still tasting the taste of success
item.description:
Napa's still tasting the taste of success

It was the wine equivalent of the U.S hockey team's 1980 "Miracle on Ice" against the Soviets. In 1976, two Napa Valley wines, a white and a red, were put up against the crème de la crème of French wines from Burgundy and Bordeaux at a formal blind tasting in Paris and - gulp - won.

item.title: Trancas Steakhouse in Napa - where everybody knows your name
item.description:
Trancas Steakhouse in Napa - where everybody knows your name

What if you told them they could begin their evening with a cocktail closely resembling green juice, with a pea pod for garnish, at Ninebark? Bait them with the prospect of drinking Txakoli from the projectile arc of a porrón at La Taberna or sipping a proper martini in the Provencal-inflected Angele?

item.title: Wine Experience
item.description:
Wine Experience

"Dig Deep" into Rutherford terroir with Wine Seminars, Tours, and Tastings On Saturday, start the day with in-depth wine seminars at select Rutherford Appellation wineries. Discover more about Rutherford's unique terroir while enjoying vineyard tours, wine tasting, and conversing with winegrowers and winemakers. Two time blocks: 9:30a.m. - 11:00 a.m.

item.title: Volley in the Valley another resounding success
item.description:
Volley in the Valley another resounding success

The St. Helena Hospital Foundation hosted its sixth annual Volley in the Valley Tennis Tournament on May 1-2, benefiting St. Helena Hospital's new Hybrid Operating Room. More than 50 local tennis players participated in the two-day tournament, consisting of four Round Robin doubles tournaments, including men's, women's and mixed, three tennis skill games, dinner under the stars on the Croquet Glen at Meadowood Napa Valley, and an awards ceremony with generously donated player prizes.

item.title: California wines shines at Riva Grill - Tahoe Weekly
item.description:
California wines shines at Riva Grill - Tahoe Weekly

For almost two decades, Riva Grill has been a favorite spot to wine and dine on Lake Tahoe's South Shore. Viewed from the lake on a winter's eve it shines star bright, and in summer it features sun-drenched decks with lake and mountain views to amaze.
